sections.title: Scenario introduction: existing DB initializer with Entity Framework
sections.summary: Presenter describes a real project scenario (products project) using Entity Framework and questions whether the current DB initializer approach is correct.
key_actions: Review current products list, DbContext and DB initializer implementation (00:00:01.840–00:00:17.920)
Decide to use Copilot agent to validate/improve implementation (00:00:17.920–00:00:23.520)

sections.title: Enable GitHub Copilot agent and search Microsoft Docs
sections.summary: Enable Copilot agent mode, grant it access to Microsoft Docs, and ask it to search documentation for guidance on implementing a DB initializer class for EF Core 9.
key_actions: Enable GitHub Copilot agent mode and select Microsoft Docs as a tool (00:00:23.520–00:00:31.560)
Ask agent to search Microsoft Docs for DB initializer patterns for EF Core 9 and request answers based on full doc content (00:00:31.560–00:00:51.080)

sections.title: Permissions prompt for tools
sections.summary: Permission dialog appears to allow the agent/tools to access resources (disk, run commands). User chooses permission scope for the session.
key_actions: Read permission warning about tools accessing disk or running commands (00:00:57.240–00:01:02.360)
Choose permission option: always allow or allow only this time; presenter chooses allow only this time for the demo (00:01:02.360–00:01:14.800)

sections.title: Agent run and recommendations returned
sections.summary: Agent processes the request (took a few minutes) and returns recommendations: EF Core 9 has a different recommended approach for DB initialization, includes links to docs and suggestions for improved implementation.
key_actions: Wait for agent to run and analyze documentation and project (00:01:24.960–00:01:29.888)
Receive recommendations that current initializer works but EF Core 9 recommends a different approach, plus reference links (00:01:29.888–00:01:58.680)

sections.title: Trigger agent to implement suggested changes; session/model selection
sections.summary: User asks the agent to implement the recommended changes. A new agent session is triggered and tied to a chosen model (options mentioned: GPT-4.1, GPT-5). Agent begins reading related project files (Program.cs, DbContext) to prepare code changes.
key_actions: Request agent to implement recommended code changes (00:02:09.320)
Trigger a new agent session and choose a model (GPT-4.1 or GPT-5) (00:02:12.400–00:02:17.320)
Agent reads relevant classes and project files (Program, DbContext, etc.) to plan edits (00:02:25.738–00:02:41.122)

sections.title: Agent applies changes and final recommendations (EF Core 9)
sections.summary: Agent implements code changes to align with EF Core 9 recommendations: refactors DB initialization, suggests using migrations and MigrateAsync instead of EnsureCreated/EnsureCreatedAsync, provides conditional async/sync handling and improved sample data initialization.
key_actions: Agent modifies classes to implement the recommended DB initialization approach (00:02:41.122–00:02:51.653)
Agent finishes processing and reports that new approach aligns with EF Core 9 docs (00:02:51.653–00:02:59.280)
Recommendation to use Database.MigrateAsync (or Migrate) instead of EnsureCreated/EnsureCreatedAsync when moving migrations (00:02:59.280–00:03:07.970)
Agent implements conditional handling (sync vs async) and better sample-data seeding based on documentation (00:03:07.970–00:03:44.720)

main_topics: Using GitHub Copilot Agents to consult Microsoft Docs
DB initializer patterns for Entity Framework Core 9
Tool permission controls for agent access
Model selection for agent sessions (GPT variants)
